member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect
member.summary: Applies an arbitrary 2D filter kernel to an image. This can perform operations such as edge detect, emboss, sharpen, or blur.

remarks.p: A convolve filter works by sampling a number of source pixels from around the location whose output value is being computed, weighting each sample by the corresponding value from the filter kernel matrix, and summing the results. Different filter kernels can produce a wide range of image processing effects. Although the following examples all use the default 3x3 KernelWidth and KernelHeight, this can be set to any size (note that large kernels are more expensive).
Box blur (note that is usually a better way to blur an image):
This Windows Runtime type corresponds to the D2D Convolve matrix effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.Source

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelWidth
member.summary: Width of the filter kernel matrix. Default value 3.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelHeight
member.summary: Height of the filter kernel matrix. Default value 3.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelMatrix
member.summary: The filter kernel matrix. This array must be sized KernelWidth * KernelHeight. Default value {0,0,0,0,1,0,0,0,0}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelScale
member.summary: Scales how the filter kernel is mapped onto the 2D source image. Default value (1,1).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelOffset
member.summary: Shifts the filter kernel from its default position centered on the output pixel. Default value (0,0).
member.remarks: With some offsets and kernel sizes, convolution samples won't land directly on a pixel center. In that case, sample values are computed by bilinear interpolation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.Divisor
member.summary: After the filter kernel is applied to a pixel, the result is divided by this value. Default 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.Offset
member.summary: After applying the filter kernel and divisor, this offset is added to the result. Default value 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Interpolation mode used to scale the source image to the specified KernelScale. Default value .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.PreserveAlpha
member.summary: Specifies whether the convolution filter is applied to alpha as well as the color channels. When set to true, only the color channels are filtered, while alpha values are kept unchanged. Default value false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.ClampOutput
member.summary: If set, the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before passing them on to the next effect in the graph. If false, the effect will not clamp values, although subsequent effects or the output surface may later clamp if they are not of high enough precision. Default value false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.BorderMode
